definition: to level/to raze to the ground
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Massive 9)tremors have brought down entire cities in this part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 大地震曾把这一地区的城市夷为平地。

sentences.english: Between 15% and 20% of global warming pollution is caused by the razing of forests.
sentences.chinese: 把森林夷为平地导致15%至20%全球变暖污染。

sentences.english: In 1974 Darwin was devastated by Cyclone Tracy.
sentences.chinese: 1974年达尔文被热带气旋特蕾西夷为平地。

sentences.english: The world trade building was razed to the ground in the big explosion yesterday…
sentences.chinese: 大厦在昨天的大爆炸中被夷为平地。

sentences.english: They need a big tsunami to take out their little sand forts.
sentences.chinese: 来一场海啸把他们的小沙堡夷为平地。

sentences.english: I'll raze this place to hell!
sentences.chinese: 我会把这里给夷为平地。

sentences.english: The earth-quake laid the city flat.
But fate intervenes when the house of Kotoko's family is destroyed by a meteor.
sentences.chinese: 但命运捉弄，琴子的家被一颗流星夷为平地。

sentences.english: Vast stretches of Coruscant's surface were laid to waste in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 科洛桑的表面在战火中被大片大片地夷为平地。

sentences.english: Almost all buildings were level(l)ed to the ground by the atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的建筑物都被原子弹夷为平地了。

sentences.english: My heart goes out to them too…I wish forMother Nature to raze them to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我也同情这些动物，我希望大自然将他们夷为平地。

sentences.english: Hittin sound, watch me act bugged, and tear it down.
sentences.chinese: 撞击的声音，看着我混乱的表现，把一切夷为平地。

sentences.english: Soon we were seeing whole villages that had been flattened.
sentences.chinese: 不多暂我们便瞅睹不少村庄整个夷为平地。

sentences.english: The city had deemed the crumbling edifice structurally unsound, clearing the way for the couple to raze it.
sentences.chinese: 清理掉了那夫妇的路，然后把它们夷为平地。

sentences.english: The building has been torn down in Hsin-Ying Sugar Factory.
sentences.chinese: 新营糖厂内已遭夷为平地的房舍。

sentences.english: Some villages nearby in the central Italian region were all but flattened.
sentences.chinese: 许多位于意大利中部地区的村庄被夷为平地。

definition: to level/to raze to the ground
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
ruins
to collapse (of building)/to topple over
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to destroy/to wreck
scorched earth
to bomb
rubble/debris
to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
to dismantle/to demolish
crumbling fences and dilapidated walls (idiom)
to damage/to devastate/to vandalize/damage/destruction
fine powder/broken pieces
to blow up (demolish with an explosion)
